title: Sri Lanka rupee bid at 315 to the US dollar
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee bid was at 315 to the US dollar in the interbank market though there are no offers and trades, dealers said, as a monetary meltdown long predicted by analysts since a discretionary flexible inflation targeting regime gathered pace.
Trades were cleared for imports at rates around 325 to the US dollar.
The central bank’s indicative spot was 309/319 to the US dollar.
In the kerb market, the rupee was 360/405 to the US dollar, easing somewhat from two weeks earlier.
With some money changers coming under fire from regulators, business is shifting to the underground mafia operators, market sources said.
Banks are also facing severe problems with counterparty limits cut not just for credit but also for other transactions like cross-currency swaps.
Banks are unable to engage in cross-currency swaps, and Sri Lanka letters of credit are losing currency financial sources said.
Sri Lanka did not have a finance minister and no Finance Minister has been appointed by Thursday morning. (Colombo/Apr07/2022)
